active_posts_this_week.title: Ordinal Inscription Size Limits
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Blockchain scalability issues stem from transaction broadcasting and storage demands.
- Covenant technology allows shared UTXO control, improving efficiency and retaining asset security.
- Solutions like Lightning and Ark, using covenant technology, aim to enhance scalability.

active_posts_this_week.title: Lamport scheme (not signature) to economize on L1
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The sender proposes integrating a scheme into Bitcoin, requiring miner acceptance for authentication.
- They suggest using commitment transactions like smart contracts, with minimal data added for mining.
- Despite slower validation over multiple blocks, they accept it as a trade-off for security.

active_posts_this_week.title: Swift Activation - CTV
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Multisig schemes are widely used, while Covenant Transaction Variant (CTV) lacks specific applications.
- The adoption of CTV may have unintended consequences, including fund immobilization due to restrictions.
- Evaluating CTV's viability requires building out use cases and avoiding activation without consensus.

active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The new Bitcoin Core updates introduce a Compressed Transaction Schema to reduce transaction sizes.
- Compression methods benefit low bandwidth scenarios and allow customized transaction efficiency.
- Documentation, including test vectors and savings illustrations, is available at the provided GitHub link.

active_posts_this_week.title: V3 Transactions are still vulnerable to significant tx pinning griefing attacks
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Commitment transactions on the Lightning Network are lighter than previously estimated.
- Using v3 protocol, the cost of attack-induced fees is substantially reduced for users.
